Package org.rcsb.mbt.structLoader

File loaders are contained in this package.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
IFileStructureLoader Defines the standard interface for classes which know how to load a Structure from a file or url object.
IStructureLoader Defines the standard interface for classes which know how to load Structure objects.
 

Class Summary
PdbStructureLoader Implements the StructureLoader interface to enable reading of PDB files either from local disk or from a URL.
StructureXMLHandler Invoked by the SAX while parsing the XML file.
XMLStructureLoader This is a shell around the StructureXMLHandler class.
 

Enum Summary
StructureXMLHandler.eIsParsing Parsing flags - some of the end element operations are controlled by these
 

Package org.rcsb.mbt.structLoader Description

File loaders are contained in this package. Currently, only two filetypes are supported:

  • .pdb (org.rcsb.mbt.structLoader.PDBStructureLoader) - the original 80 character punchcard image format.
  • .xml (XMLStructureLoader) - an xml representation of .cif data.

Note the IStructureLoader interface. This primarily defines common accessors to resultant information from the loading operation.

Both the PdbStructureLoader and the StructureXMLHandler are capable of loading gzip'ed files.

Non-protein Chain Identification and Breakout

There was a significant difference in the way these loaded the structure - a problem for further viewing and analysis. The XMLStructureLoader has far more data to work with and can break out non-protein information more completely. The PDBStructureLoader has far less information to work with, however it can approximate the XMLStructureLoader behavior.

Read the documentation at the head of each of these for further information.

Note: The structure loaders were originally served up by a factory class that instantiated and provided loaders by type requested. That mechanism has been completely bypassed, so I've lifted it out and put it in in the 'RCSB Excluded' project.

A shame, really - I thought it was a good idea.

21-Oct-08 - rickb
